result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly L. Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kimberly L. Acevedo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kimberly L. Acevedo was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly L. Acevedo

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund; gb/jg  ck#16CH075610 & 16CH075611
Fine/costs of $250 totals $568 plus a $10 state charge for any statue that starts with a 943, plus $20 DNA surcharge - Total is $778.00  taken out of bond.
Per Judge, bond forfeited on 11/23 to be reinstated.
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement
$715 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:   1115 - DE enters plea of guilty asto Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders a $250 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or civil judgment. No restitution requested. DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $200 DNA surcharge and notice is given. Appeal rights given.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  DE appears in person with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  926 -  DE's husband had a medical emergency the day of the previous hearing. DE contacted Atty Breckenfelder hours after the hearing to set up a VA. Bench Warrant is withdrawn, and PLEAS scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Voluntary appearance scheduled 12/2/15 @ 8:45am. Parties notified by e-mail.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears for DE. DE does not appear.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  Atty Breckemfelder has no explanation as to the DE's non-appearance and requests a BWAR be stayed 1 week. $200 cash bond is forfeit. $500 BWAR ordered; stayed until 12/2/15 at 12pm.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Breckenfelder appointed last week to represent def.; requests time to review discovery and the offer from the State.  FPT 11/23/15 at 2:45.  Bond continued.
Filed by Atty L Breckenfelder.
Atty  L Breckenfelder.
Final pre-trial at 10-14-2015 08:45 am

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:07pm-  DE submitted a request for court appointed counsel but failed to appear today.  Court adjourns matter to October 14, 2015 at 08:45 am.  NTBS by the Court.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
